hook.text: Between 1985 and 1987, a radiation therapy machine gave patients lethal overdoses.

buildup.text: The Therac-25 relied entirely on software safety checks, removing all hardware interlocks.

discovery.text: A race condition let the machine fire full-power beams when operators typed commands too fast.

twist.text: The manufacturer blamed hospitals. They insisted their software was tested and safe.

climax.text: Six patients were severely injured or killed. The case rewrote software safety standards.

punchline.text: Software replaced safety hardware and people died.

quiz.question: What type of bug caused the Therac-25 overdoses?
